00015 #include "build_log.h"

00017 #include <errno.h>
00018 #include <stdio.h>
00019 #include <string.h>
00020 
00021 #include "build.h"
00022 #include "graph.h"
00023 #include "ninja.h"
00024 
00025 // Implementation details:
00026 // Each run's log appends to the log file.
00027 // To load, we run through all log entries in series, throwing away
00028 // older runs.
00029 // Once the number of redundant entries exceeds a threshold, we write
00030 // out a new file and replace the existing one with it.
00031 
00032 BuildLog::BuildLog()
00033   : log_file_(NULL), config_(NULL), needs_recompaction_(false) {}
00034 
00035 bool BuildLog::OpenForWrite(const string& path, string* err) {
00036   if (config_ && config_->dry_run)
00037     return true;  // Do nothing, report success.
00038 
00039   if (needs_recompaction_) {
00040     Close();
00041     if (!Recompact(path, err))
00042       return false;
00043   }
00044 
00045   log_file_ = fopen(path.c_str(), "ab");
00046   if (!log_file_) {
00047     *err = strerror(errno);
00048     return false;
00049   }
00050   setlinebuf(log_file_);
00051   return true;
00052 }
00053 
00054 void BuildLog::RecordCommand(Edge* edge, int time_ms) {
00055   if (!log_file_)
00056     return;
00057 
00058   const string command = edge->EvaluateCommand();
00059   for (vector<Node*>::iterator out = edge->outputs_.begin();
00060        out != edge->outputs_.end(); ++out) {
00061     const string& path = (*out)->file_->path_;
00062     Log::iterator i = log_.find(path);
00063     LogEntry* log_entry;
00064     if (i != log_.end()) {
00065       log_entry = i->second;
00066     } else {
00067       log_entry = new LogEntry;
00068       log_.insert(make_pair(path, log_entry));
00069     }
00070     log_entry->output = path;
00071     log_entry->command = command;
00072     log_entry->time_ms = time_ms;
00073 
00074     WriteEntry(log_file_, *log_entry);
00075   }
00076 }
00077 
00078 void BuildLog::Close() {
00079   if (log_file_)
00080     fclose(log_file_);
00081   log_file_ = NULL;
00082 }
00083 
00084 bool BuildLog::Load(const string& path, string* err) {
00085   FILE* file = fopen(path.c_str(), "r");
00086   if (!file) {
00087     if (errno == ENOENT)
00088       return true;
00089     *err = strerror(errno);
00090     return false;
00091   }
00092 
00093   int unique_entry_count = 0;
00094   int total_entry_count = 0;
00095 
00096   char buf[256 << 10];
00097   while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), file)) {
00098     char* start = buf;
00099     char* end = strchr(start, ' ');
00100     if (!end)
00101       continue;
00102 
00103     *end = 0;
00104     int time_ms = atoi(start);
00105     start = end + 1;
00106     end = strchr(start, ' ');
00107     string output = string(start, end - start);
00108 
00109     LogEntry* entry;
00110     Log::iterator i = log_.find(output);
00111     if (i != log_.end()) {
00112       entry = i->second;
00113     } else {
00114       entry = new LogEntry;
00115       log_.insert(make_pair(output, entry));
00116       ++unique_entry_count;
00117     }
00118     ++total_entry_count;
00119 
00120     entry->time_ms = time_ms;
00121     entry->output = output;
00122 
00123     start = end + 1;
00124     end = strchr(start, '\n');
00125     entry->command = string(start, end - start);
00126   }
00127 
00128   // Mark the log as "needs rebuiding" if it has kCompactionRatio times
00129   // too many log entries.
00130   int kCompactionRatio = 3;
00131   if (total_entry_count > unique_entry_count * kCompactionRatio)
00132     needs_recompaction_ = true;
00133 
00134   fclose(file);
00135 
00136   return true;
00137 }
00138 
00139 BuildLog::LogEntry* BuildLog::LookupByOutput(const string& path) {
00140   Log::iterator i = log_.find(path);
00141   if (i != log_.end())
00142     return i->second;
00143   return NULL;
00144 }
00145 
00146 void BuildLog::WriteEntry(FILE* f, const LogEntry& entry) {
00147   fprintf(f, "%d %s %s\n",
00148           entry.time_ms, entry.output.c_str(), entry.command.c_str());
00149 }
00150 
00151 bool BuildLog::Recompact(const string& path, string* err) {
00152   printf("Recompacting log...\n");
00153 
00154   string temp_path = path + ".recompact";
00155   FILE* f = fopen(temp_path.c_str(), "wb");
00156   if (!f) {
00157     *err = strerror(errno);
00158     return false;
00159   }
00160 
00161   for (Log::iterator i = log_.begin(); i != log_.end(); ++i) {
00162     WriteEntry(f, *i->second);
00163   }
00164 
00165   fclose(f);
00166   if (unlink(path.c_str()) < 0) {
00167     *err = strerror(errno);
00168     return false;
00169   }
00170 
00171   if (rename(temp_path.c_str(), path.c_str()) < 0) {
00172     *err = strerror(errno);
00173     return false;
00174   }
00175 
00176   return true;
00177 }
